articles.description: Follow BBC Radio 5 Live commentary and live text as Man Utd face Galatasaray and Arsenal host Lens in the Champions League.
articles.title: Champions League: Man Utd v Galatasaray - match on after pitch inspection

articles.description: Luke Donald will remain Europe's Ryder Cup captain for the 2025 edition in New York after leading his team to victory in Rome in October.
articles.title: Donald to remain Europe captain for 2025 Ryder Cup

articles.description: England captain Owen Farrell makes himself unavailable for the 2024 Six Nations "in order to prioritise his and his family's mental wellbeing".
articles.title: Farrell to miss Six Nations to prioritise mental wellbeing

articles.description: Follow live text coverage from six games in the Championship, with Leicester, Ipswich, Leeds and Southampton in action.
articles.title: Championship: Leicester, Ipswich, Leeds & Southampton all in action

articles.description: Seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton gives an expansive, revealing interview as he reflects on the 2023 Formula 1 season.
articles.title: 'Is it me?' - Hamilton on self-doubt and a 'North Star'

articles.description: British coaches are no longer allowed to weigh gymnasts under new rules to protect "physical and psychological health".
articles.title: Coaches banned from weighing gymnasts in new rules

articles.description: The French Alps is named as the preferred host for the 2030 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games, while Salt Lake City is put forward for 2034.
articles.title: French Alps named preferred 2030 Winter Games host

articles.description: Watch Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta nutmeg midfielder Martin Odegaard in a training session, before running away in celebration.
articles.title: Arsenal boss Arteta nutmegs Odegaard in training

articles.description: Former India batter Rahul Dravid remains head coach in all formats and signs a contract extension.
articles.title: Dravid signs extension to remain India head coach

articles.description: Seven-time world champion Ronnie O'Sullivan says he was asked to "consider future" in a recent letter from snooker's governing body.
articles.title: Snooker bosses 'asked me to consider my future'
